@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: classes
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description: This mixin generate all the sugar classes like utilities for colors, fonts, margins, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: astNodesToString
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description:
This function just take an AST nodes array and returns the string version of it
with ";" when needed, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: isInScope
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description:
This function allows you to pass either a string like "*", "color", etc... or
an array of string like ['color','size'] and you will bet back a simple
boolean that let you know if the current code execution is in the
requested scope specified by the use of the ```@sugar.scope``` mixin directly in your css

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: jsObjectToCssProperties
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description:
This function allows you to pass a javascript object that contain css properties
and it will returns the processed css string. Some properties can accept internal theme configuration
settings like `font-size`, `color`, etc...:

- `font-family`
- `font-size`
- `color`
- `background-color`
- `border-radius`: And all border-radius properties like `border-top-left-radius`, etc...
- `border-width`
- `transition`
- `margin`: And all the margins properties like `margin-inline`, etc...
- `padding`: And all the paddings properties like `padding-block`, etc...
- `depth`: Special property that will apply nice shadows depending on your theme configuration
- `default-color`: Apply the default color using `@sugar.color` mixin

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: themeInstance
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description:
Gives you access to the current theme STheme instance in order to access
utilities methods like loopOnColors, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: themeVar
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description:
This function take a simple theme dot path and returns the proper
variable string with the value fallback.

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.name: abs
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.description:
This mixin allows you to center an item using the absolute method. Here's the accepted alignements:

- <s-color="accent">top</s-color>: Align item to the top
- <s-color="accent">left</s-color>: Align item to the left
- <s-color="accent">right</s-color>: Align item to the right
- <s-color="accent">bottom</s-color>: Align item to the bottom
- <s-color="accent">center</s-color>: Align item to the center (x and y)
- <s-color="accent">center-x</s-color>: Align item to the center-x
- <s-color="accent">center-y</s-color>: Align item to the center-y

These values can be specified like "top right", "bottom center-x", etc...

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.name: Global reset
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like \`destyle\` and/or the \`sugar\` one.
The \`destyle\` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The \`sugar\` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.name: Sugar reset
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.description: These mixins allows you to apply the \`sugar\` reset easily.

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.name: sugar
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.nod.description:
This mixin print the sugar css reset that makes:

1. Handle body height for IOS devices using the "fill-available" and "min-height: -webkit-fill-available;" technique
2. Ensure template are not displayed
3. Ensure hidden things are not displayed
4. Set the box-sizing to border box for all HTMLElement
5. Set the webkit highlight color to transparent color
6. Remote outline on every elements
7. Set the max-width to 100% for images

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.name: Scale
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like \`padding\`,
\`margin\`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the \`sugar.scallable\` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the \`font-size\` of your UI element to \`sugar.scalable(1rem)\`
and then to set inner values using \`em\` unit.

@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.name: s-scale:${scaleName}
@coffeekraken.s-postcss-sugar-plugin.sug.description:
This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>${scaleName}</yellow>" scale style to any HTMLElement.
Note that this scale is not applied using the "transform" property but it will scale
all the properties that uses the function "sugar.scalable" to set his value.

I'm a cool scaled title

since 2.0.0
